Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is getting enough water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that is not getting enough water, showing it as wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant that is not receiving enough light, showing it as not growing well or looking weak.
The student can illustrate the importance of water and light by comparing healthy plants with those that lack water or light.
The student can use visual patterns to show that all plants need light and water to survive and grow.
